div1.p: In the United States District Court in and for the Western District of Washington, Norther Division.
In the Matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro alias B.K. Sugiuro for a writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2504 Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus.

This cause coming on to be heard upon the petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro duly signed and verified, whereby it appears that they are illegally imprisoned and restrained of their liberty by Joseph R.H. Jacoby, United States Marshall in and for the Court and District aforesaid, in the county jail in the city of Seattle, King County, Washington, and from which it appears that a writ of habeas corpus ought to issue.

Now therefore, it is ordered that a writ of habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of the above entitled court directed to the said Joseph R.H. Joacoby commanding him to have the bodies of said Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro before me in the court room of the United States District Court at the Federal Building in the city of Seattle within the district aforesaid on the 23rd day of June, 1913 in the afternoon noon of said day to do and receive what it shall then and there be considered of concerning the said Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro together with the cause of their detention and that they have then and there the said writ.
Done in open Court this 19th day of June 1913.
In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington Nothern Division
In the Matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro alias B.K. Sugiuro for a writ of habeas Corpus.
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington. Jun 19 1913 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, EML Deputy
Wardall, Wardall & Martin Attorneys for petitioners 540-1-2 New York Block Seattle Main 7465
